Feature Operations¶

Feature operations classes:

FeatureIO: Class to perform various input/output and manipulations of features present in dataframe

FeatureNormalization: Class to normalize and unnormalize features in a dataframe.

MiscFeatureOperations: Class containing additional feature operations

Code¶

class FeatureOperations.FeatureIO(dataframe)[source]¶

Class to perform various input/output and manipulations of features present in dataframe

Parameters:dataframe (pandas dataframe) – dataframe containing x and y data and feature names
remove_duplicate_features_by_name()¶

DEPRECATED

remove_duplicate_columns()¶

removes features that have identical names

Returns:dataframe after feature operation
Return type:pandas dataframe
remove_duplicate_features_by_values()¶

removes features that have identical values for each data point

Returns:dataframe after feature operation
Return type:pandas dataframe
remove_custom_features()¶

remove features as specified by name

Parameters:features_to_remove (list) – list of feature names to remove
Returns:dataframe after feature operation
Return type:pandas dataframe
keep_custom_features()¶

keep only the specified features

Parameters:
  • features_to_keep (list) – list of feature names to keep
  • y_feature (str) – name of target feature (will keep if specified)
Returns:

dataframe after feature operation
Return type:

pandas dataframe
add_custom_features()¶

add specific features by name (must also supply data)

Parameters:
  • features_to_add (list) – list of feature names to add
  • data_to_add (numpy array) – array of data for each feature to add
Returns:

dataframe after feature operation
Return type:

pandas dataframe
custom_feature_filter()¶

removes rows of data if certain arithmetic conditions are met

Parameters:
  • feature (str) – name of feature to scan data of
  • operator (kwarg) – arithmetic operator (choose from <, >, =, <=, >=, <>)
  • threshold (float) – value to compare data value against for elimination
Returns:

dataframe after feature operation
Return type:

pandas dataframe
class FeatureOperations.FeatureNormalization(dataframe, configdict)[source]¶

Class to normalize and unnormalize features in a dataframe.

Parameters:dataframe (pandas dataframe) – dataframe containing x and y data and feature names
normalize features

normalizes the specified features to have mean zero and standard deviation of unity

Parameters:
  • x_features (list) – list of x feature names
  • y_feature (str) – target feature name
  • normalize_x_features (bool) – whether to normalize x features
  • normalize_y_feature (bool) – whether to normalize the target feature
  • to_csv (bool) – whether to save normalized dataframe to csv file
Returns:

dataframe of normalized data sklearn scaler object : scaler object used to map unnormalized to normalized data
Return type:

pandas dataframe
minmax_scale_single_feature()¶

scale a single feature to a designated minimum and maximum value

Parameters:
  • featurename (str) – name of feature to normalize
  • smin (float) – minimum feature value
  • smax (float) – maximum feature value
Returns:

dataframe containing only the scaled feature
Return type:

pandas dataframe
unnormalize_features()¶

unnormalize the features contained in a dataframe

Parameters:
  • x_features (list) – list of x feature names
  • y_feature (str) – target feature name
  • scaler (sklearn scaler object) – scaler object used to map unnormalized to normalized data
Returns:

dataframe of unnormalized data sklearn scaler object : scaler object used to map unnormalized to normalized data
Return type:

pandas dataframe
normalize_and_merge_with_original_dataframe()¶

normalizes features and merges normalized dataframe with original dataframe

Parameters:
  • x_features (list) – list of x feature names
  • y_feature (str) – target feature name
Returns:

merged dataframe containing original dataframe and normalized features
Return type:

pandas dataframe
class FeatureOperations.MiscFeatureOperations(configdict)[source]¶

Class containing additional feature operations

Parameters:configdict (dict) – MASTML configfile object as dict
remove_features_containing_strings()¶

removes feature columns whose values are strings as these can’t be used in regression tasks

Parameters:
  • dataframe (pandas dataframe) – dataframe containing data and feature names
  • x_features (list) – list of x feature names
Returns:

list of x features with those features removed which contained data as strings pandas dataframe : dataframe containing data and feature names, with string features removed
Return type:

list
